title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: This board had a short on it which was resolved by replacing [CAPACITORS]C7371[/CAPACITORS]. Now I still have no power but on <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PPBUS_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from.  [/INST]</s> I have 500mV and slowly rising up to 1+V. Never seen behavior like that so not sure what to do or go after next. Checked all points for <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PPBUS_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from.  [/INST]</s> they all show the same number. When I disconnect power and a minute later reconnect it, it picks up where it left off, only dropping a few mV so the charge is being kept somewhere, just don't understand the behavior.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: Check resistance between pins 17/18 27/28 of the <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6259[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015 [/INST]</s>. Also this machine should run from a charged battery is problem is simply with the ISL circuit.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: 2.3 Ohm between 17/18, 19.8 Ohm between 27/28. No power from battery but according to the magsafe when connected it is still charging, percentage unknown.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: Unless the battery is known good and holds a charge this is no help. What is resistance to GND on PPBUS? Is the PPBUS fuse good? DCIN on <s>[INST] [CHIPS]ISL6259[/CHIPS]: This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015 [/INST]</s> getting power?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: Resistance to GND on PPBUS is 25 kOhm and climbing. Fuse (F7700) is good. DCIN on U7100 is 14.38V

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: Green/orange light present? Getting DCIN on [RESISTORS]R7120[/RESISTORS]?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: 14.30V on all pins of [RESISTORS]R7120[/RESISTORS]. Magsafe light is orange.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: Where are you measuring PPBUS? Measure on the coil before the fuse? Is the fuse popped?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: I measured all the points the BV highlighted when I searched <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PPBUS_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from.  [/INST]</s>, a coil is not shown as one of those points. I also can't find a coil before the fuse in the schematic. The fuse is good though.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message:
You are maybe looking at F7700 whitch is another fuse for ppbus_g3h near backlight circuit.

There is another fuse right in the begining of <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PBUS_G3H[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PBUS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H [/INST]</s> it's F7140, and before this fuse there is a coil L7130, check the fuse and measure PPBUS on the coil and the fuse.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H

<s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message:
jadao and dukefawkes I will check on your suggestions in a moment. 

I found that F7140 was bad so replaced it, now get same 8.6V on both sides. Re-measuring the G3H line I run into a dead end at Q5500, I think. It has the right voltage coming in but is not shooting out PBUS S0 VSENSE to the SMC. The enable signal is coming in at 8.38V which is correct as far as I can tell.

L7130 gives me 8.6V on both sides.
F7700 also 8.6V on both sides.

Going to look for a Q5500 replacement and report back.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: And replacing Q5500 has same result.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message:
If ppbus_g3h 8,6v is present and you have green/orange light, you should go further by checking other power rails.
do you have S5 power rails, S4, S3?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message:
Q5500 is just for voltage sensing and has nothing to do with power on.
So the PPBUS issue was a simple dead fuse, which makes sense after a short on that rail. Is the green/orange light present now? <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP3V3_S5[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state [/INST]</s> present?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message:
Started measuring rails from scratch and hit a dead end at <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]PP5V_S4RS3[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: PP5V_S4RS3 is a 5v power rail present when the machine is in an S4 suspend to disk state. [/INST]</s>.
Leading this all the way back to the DC board of which I have tried 3, all resulting in no power.
I have no schematic for the DC board (820-3453-A) but there's a Cap that measures 14.87V on one side and 0V on the other side.... on all 3 of my DC boards. Don't know if that's OK or if all 3 of my boards are now f'd.

Attached is a picture.

Orange/green light still present.

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: Are there DC boards from other models that are compatible?

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message: About the cap, of course you will have voltaje on one side because is in the + line and the other side is GND....

title: <s>[INST] [LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]820-00164[/LOGIC_BOARD_PART_NUMBERS]: Board part number 820-00164 fits a MacBook Air computer from year Early 2015 whose model number is A1465 with a screen size of 11" and an EMC number of EMC 2924 [/INST]</s> no power, weird behavior on PPBUS-G3H
message:
Don't even need an IO board, these boards will power on without a green light so connecting only the power cable is enough. No need to plug in the flat cable.

No S4 can be absolutely anything and this board has history so it could be any knocked off component. As this was not water damage, physical damage is the most likely suspect. See if the <s>[INST] [SIGNAL_NAMES]5V_S4[/SIGNAL_NAMES]: This is an abbreviation of “PP5V_S4” – when you see this, assume the person typing it meant to type “PP5V_S4” [/INST]</s> rail is pulsing, check PPVRTC.
